newsitem.title: INDIA: India CRISIL assigns P1 rating to RML.
newsitem.headline: India CRISIL assigns P1 rating to RML.

text.p: India's Credit Rating Information Services of India Ltd (CRISIL) said in a statement on Wednesday that the P1 rating has been assigned to 45 million rupees commercial paper programme of Rajapalayam Mills Limited (RML).
The rating indicates that the degree of safety with regard to timely payment of interest and principal is high.

RML is part of the textile division of the Madras-based RAMCO group of companies. The company is one of the oldest spinning mills in the country but has invested regularly in modernisation and replacement to maintain productivity.
In addition to selling its yarn in the domestic market, the company also has two export-oriented units which accounted for over 40 percent of sales in 1996/97.

The company has reported a considerable improvement in turnover and profits in 1996/97 which have increased to 987.9 million rupees and 68.3 million rupees respectively as compared to 801.8 million rupees 15.3 million rupees in 1995/96.
